Dear Mr. HANNAH:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and
your contract.

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (734) 395-0920.
Sincerely,

INVESTIGATION:
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written policies
Description and procedures that prohibit the following forms of intervention:
(a)Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a youth on
any part of their body.
4

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth has a bruise on their left arm that came from a staff member
grabbing youth's arm and digging their fingers into youth's arm when
they tried to leave the facility on 12/10/22. There are no incident reports
regarding this.
Investigation Interviews:
During an on-site visit on 12/15/22 Youth A was viewed and talked to
but not interviewed about the incident due to the DHHS Worker not
being present. He had a bruise on his right arm near his elbow that was
about a quarter size and had a small scab in the center. Youth A said
he moved units since the incident with Staff 1. Staff 1 is at a different
site.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on 12/20/22 along
with the DHHS Worker and Police Officer. Youth A stated Staff 1 dug
her nails into his arms. He said the injury has now healed. He reported
he was about to run out the back door when Staff 1 grabbed him to
keep him from running out. When Staff 1 grabbed him her nails dug into
his arm. He could not recall if she used one hand or both hands. Youth
A said he tried to shake her hand off of him. Staff 1 was standing at the
time. Youth A was in front of the back door and she was within an arm's
reach of him. She grabbed his arm from behind as Staff 2 grabbed his
other arm from behind, but he only reported that Staff 1 dug nails into
him. Three other staff were present: Staff 2, Staff 3, and Staff 4. He
listed 5 youth that were present Youth B, Youth C, Youth D, Youth E,
and Youth F. Youth A said they were all in the back room playing video
games while Staff 1 and Staff 2 were by the back door located in the
same room as the video games. Staff 3 was by the hallway. Afterwards
Youth A went to talk to the supervisor. He was unsure which hand Staff
1 used to grab him.
During the on-site on 12/15/22 the Program Manager (PM) stated
Youth A saw the nurse. There was no incident report because staff said
she did not touch him. The facility does not have cameras.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 12/20/22 along
with the DHHS Worker 1 and Police Officer. She reported Youth A was
trying to tell her what to do. He wanted to play a game, but she told him
she needed to check first. She told him he was last, and this made him
upset. Youth A called Staff 1 names and cussed at her. He then threw a
speaker across the floor. Staff 1 reported Youth A then went toward the
door as Staff 1 went to pick up the speaker. Another staff reportedly
stopped Youth A from leaving but she did not see what staff stopped
him or how he was stopped. Other staff that worked that night were
Staff 2, Staff 3, and Staff 6. Staff 1 said Youth A did not need to be
4

restrained. She stated Staff 2 was talking to Youth A when he went
toward the door but she did not know if he placed his hands on Youth A
as she had gotten up to get the speaker. Staff 1 said she did not touch
Youth A and she did not see anyone put their hands on Youth A. Staff 1
refrained from speaking to Youth A because he was mad at her. She
reported Youth B, Youth E, and Youth F were present. The incident
occurred around 6 or 7pm. Staff 1 stated she does not know Staff 2 as
they have always worked in different units. Staff 1 did have acrylic nails
that were grown out indicating she had them for a while. The nails were
long but rounded without any sharp edges.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 12/20/22 along
with the DHHS Worker and Police Officer. He reported he does work
2nd shift on Saturdays and remembers the day Youth A was mad and
tried to leave out the back door. Staff 1 and Staff 2 were reportedly
working, but he was unsure if Staff 4 or Staff 6 were working. Staff 3
was on the unit watching the showers. He said he did not see anything,
he just heard staff telling Youth A they could not let him leave. He
thought it was Staff 2 who was talking to Youth A. He did not hear Staff
1 say anything. Staff 3 did not have any concerns with Staff 1 or Staff 2.
He also did not see any injuries on Youth A. He stated after the incident
Youth A was back to being his normal self, which is very disrespectful.
Youth A dislikes everybody and treats everyone with the same amount
of disrespect. He did not have any concerns with how staff handle
Youth A.
Staff 4 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 12/20/22 along
with the DHHS Worker and Police Officer. She reported she works
second shift but she does not work on Saturdays and she does not
work with Staff 1 or Staff 2.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility along with the DHHS
Worker on 1/6/23. He stated on the evening that Youth A tried to run
out the back door, that Staff 2 was at the front door. He said he was not
at the back door. Youth A reportedly ran to the back door when he was
already in the back room. Youth A never ran to the front door. Youth A
was yelling at Staff 1 and cussing her out. He did not see what
happened, only heard Youth A say he wanted to leave. The supervisor
came in when Youth A was yelling. Staff 1 and Supervisor were at the
back door with Youth A. Staff 2 said that no one can physically stop
Youth A because they are not to stop them from running anymore.
Youth A stayed because Supervisor was talking to him. Staff 2 was not
at the back door but could see it by stepping forward. Youth A was just
yelling and telling Staff 1 to get out of his way while Staff 1 was
standing in front of the door. He said he never saw Staff 1 touch Youth
A. He did not see any injuries on Youth A. Staff 2 said he used to work
4

with Staff 1 at another camp and he did not have any concerns with
her. He never even heard her raise her voice. He said she talks to the
kids and knows what she is doing. He has not seen her become
physical with any youth. There were no other staff around during the
incident.
A follow-up phone call was placed to Staff 2 on 1/10/23. He stated he
has never touched Youth A in order to stop him from exiting the unit. He
has never pulled on Youth A’s shirt or arm to stop him.
Staff 5 was interviewed face to face at the facility along with the DHHS
Worker on 1/6/23. She reported she has been at the facility less than
two months. She was not present when Youth A tried to go out the back
door when Staff 1 was working. She has never worked with both Staff 1
and Staff 2 at the same time. She said she has worked with Staff 1 and
has seen her redirect Youth A and ask him not to talk to her with
disrespect. She did not recall Youth A trying to leave. She did not have
any concerns with Staff 1.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility along with the
DHHS Worker on 1/6/23. He reported he was working the evening of
the incident. He heard Youth A cussing and yelling so he went to the
unit and Youth A was trying to get out the door. He was telling staff to
move. Supervisor stated Staff 1 and Staff 2 were both at the back door
stopping Youth A from leaving. They were standing in front of the door
while Youth A was calling them names and Youth A was mad because
he could not get out. Supervisor convinced Youth A to go with him and
talk to him. Supervisor did not see anyone get physical with Youth A
and Youth A did not push against the staff. When talking to Youth A,
Supervisor said Youth A never mentioned anything about staff touching
him or causing an injury. Youth A was reportedly mad that Staff 1
provides structure when other staff do not. Staff 1 is good with the kids
and does a good job. He has not seen her get physical with any of the
youth.
Youth D was interviewed face to face at the facility along with the
DHHS Worker on 1/6/23. Youth D did not know who Staff 1 was. Youth
D said that Youth A tries to go out the back door only when certain staff
are working. Youth A likes to walk out. Staff 2 will sit in front of the
door. If Youth A tries to reach past him Staff 2 calls for the supervisor.
He has never seen Staff 2 put his hands on Youth A.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility along with the
DHHS Worker on 1/6/23. Youth B said he did not know who Staff 1
was, but Youth A was saying Staff 1 was writing him up for stupid stuff.
He knows Staff 2 and said Staff 2 and Youth A argue a lot. Youth A
4

once stormed out of the unit door and Staff 1 grabbed him by the shirt.
He said he also saw Staff 2 grab Youth A by the back of his shirt when
Youth A went to step off the unit. Staff 2 pulled Youth A back into the
unit after Youth A had stepped out about two steps. He could not
remember who else was working or when this occurred. Youth B said
Youth A did fall on his bottom but was not hurt. Staff 2 said, "sorry but
you cannot be going out there." He said he has not seen any staff hurt
Youth A.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility along with the
DHHS Worker on 1/6/23. Youth C did not know who Staff 1 was. He
has seen Youth A try to go out the back door and they stopped him by
blocking the door. He said he never saw Staff 2 put his hands on Youth
A.
Youth E was interviewed face to face at the facility along with the
DHHS Worker on 1/6/23. Youth E stated he briefly saw Youth A try to
go out the back door when Staff 1 was working. He could not remember
who else was working. Per Youth E, there is usually one staff at the
front door and one at the back. Staff 1 was sitting in a chair at the back
door. No other staff were in the back with her. Her chair was blocking
the back door. He said he never saw Staff 1 put her hands on Youth A.
Youth A did tell Youth E that Staff 1 scratched him when she grabbed
him, but he never saw Staff 1 grab him. He said he did not see Staff 2
put his hands on Youth A.
An interview was attempted with Youth F face to face at the facility on
1/6/23. Youth F struggles with verbal communication and could not be
interviewed about the events.
During a virtual case conference on 1/13/23 the DHHS Worker reported
she did not have any findings.
Documents Reviewed:
• Staff 1 file: Staff 1 was hired on 8/28/17. All of her trainings are
up to date. She had one discipline from 2018 for disciplining
youth by placing their bedding in the shower.
• Youth A file: Youth A has a history of self-harm and aggression
towards others, he will often antagonize and threaten his peers.
• Youth A Safety Plan: One of the behaviors addressed in the
safety plan is walking out of unit or building. To help with this
Youth A is to be within line of sight of staff at all times.
• Nurses Note: Dated 12/12/22. Round shaped abrasion on right
forearm with scab and slight bruising. Abrasion inconsistent with
scratching.
4

• Hospital Documentation: Dated 12/16/22. The documentation
was not different from the nurses note.
• E-mail From Child Protection Team: The doctor could not
definitively state if Youth A’s injury was from a grab and gouge.
His injury could have been caused by many different events.
• Incident Report: Dated 12/10/22. Youth A reported Staff 1
grabbed his arm and scratched him. Staff 1 denied she touched
Youth A.
• Staff 1’s Written Statement: Dated 12/12/22. The details in her
statement were the same as her interview. She did not name the
other staff who was present.
• Truancy Policy and Procedure: Staff will make efforts to verbally
redirect the youth. Staff will not physically intervene outside of
what is allowed in Therapeutic Crisis Intervention (TCI) physical
management techniques.
Analysis Though Youth A indicated Staff 1 and Staff 2 grabbed him, none of the
other youth or staff interviewed indicated this occurred.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4157 Behavior management.
Section (1) An institution shall establish and follow written policies and
Description procedures that describe the institution’s behavior management
system. The policies and procedures shall be reviewed annually and
updated as needed. These shall be available to all residents, their
families, and referring agencies.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff did not intervene when a youth lifted another youth by his feet and
dropped him on the floor.
Investigation Interviews:
During Youth E's face to face interview at the facility on 1/6/23 he
reported Youth G lifted Youth A up by his feet and his pants fell down.
Staff 2 and Staff 3 were reportedly working at the time and they just sat
there while it happened and did not do anything to prevent the incident.
Youth E said the staff did tell Youth G not to do that. When Youth A's
pants fell down Youth G let him go. Youth G dropped Youth A onto his
head and Youth G was then moved to a different unit.
A phone call was received from Staff 2 on 1/13/23. He reported he was
put on leave due to this investigation. He stated he was not on shift
when the incident between Youth A and Youth G occurred. When he
came on shift he heard about it.
Youth G was interviewed face to face at the facility on 1/13/23. Youth G
said he picked Youth A up off the ground and dropped him on his head.
He did not know what staff were working. He thinks staff tried to grab
4

him but was unsure. He could not remember who was all present but
stated Staff 2 was not there. Youth G then remembered that Staff 3 was
there and maybe Staff 7 but the incident occurred after school and
before Staff 2 arrived. He reported they get out of school at 2:30pm.
Another face-to-face interview was conducted with Youth A at the
facility on 1/13/23. Youth A was upset at the time and uncooperative
with staff but he was able to answer a few questions. He confirmed that
Youth G picked him up by his shirt and slammed him down on the
ground. He stated Youth G lifted Youth A off the ground. The staff were
present when this occurred and told Youth G to put Youth A down. He
stated the staff in the room were Staff 2 and Staff 3.
Face to face at the facility on 1/13/23 Program Manager reported the
log sheet from 12/20/22 was completed by Staff 2 with exception of the
note about this incident. That note was in Staff 3’s handwriting. She
stated Staff 2 comes in at 2:30pm and works with an AM staff who
stays until 3pm when Staff 2 comes in. This incident did occur between
the time Staff 3 came on shift and when Staff 2 came on shift.
Staff 3 was interviewed on 1/23/23 by telephone. He reported he did
remember the incident between Youth A and Youth G. He said the two
boys were joking back and forth when Youth A said something about
Youth G's sister. Youth G, while still laughing, told Youth A not to talk
about his sister. Youth G then picked Youth A up. When this happened
Youth A's pants fell down. Staff 3 said he intervened and took hold of
Youth A to put him on the ground. Staff 3 stated he never touched
Youth G. He then talked to Youth G about this behavior not being
allowed. Staff 3 could not recall the other staff that were working.
Three telephone messages were left for Staff 7 on 1/17/23, 1/20/23,
and 1/23/23 but a return call was never received. An e-mail was sent to
the Chief Administrator to have Staff 7 return my calls. As of the writing
of this report he has not returned those phone calls.
Document Reviewed:
• Youth G's case file: History of Assault, trouble managing and
controlling anger and aggression.
• Staff 2's Personnel File: Hired on 8/11/20, He is up to date on his
trainings. Staff 2 had one discipline related to a previous
investigation for inappropriate communication.
• Staff 3 Personnel File: Hired in November of 2022. Completed all
trainings at that time. He had one discipline for failing to respond
to youth fighting.
• Staff 7’s Personnel File: Hired 10/13/03. He is up to date on his
trainings. He had one discipline for insubordination in 2022.
4

• Shift Log: Included a note from Staff 3 stating Youth A and Youth
G were horseplaying when Youth A's pants fell down. Staff 3
separated the two boys and Youth A ran off the unit.
• Behavior Support and Management Policy: the facility is to
provide immediate emotional and environmental support to
clients in crisis so that stress and the risk of violence is reduced.
Analysis From the interviews of the two youth involved and the staff present
there is no indication staff did not intervein in the incident.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written policies
Description and procedures that prohibit the following forms of intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(v) Peer-on-peer discipline.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff are having the youth block other youth when they try to run out of
the building.
Investigation Interviews:
During interviews with Youth B, Youth C, Youth D, and Youth E on
1/6/2023, they all indicated the youth are utilized by staff to block the
exit doors when other youth try to exit. They all agreed they are not
allowed to touch the youth they just block them from getting to the door.
During Youth B's interview he reported he did restrain Youth A at one
point when Youth A was running for the back door and staff was at the
front door. Youth B stated he did get written up for it. All the youth
indicate the staff tell them to "post up" meaning they are to block the
door.
Face to face at the facility on 1/6/23 the program manager was asked
about staff using the youth to “post up.” She stated they are not allowed
to utilize the youth to stop their peers from running.
During Staff 2’s telephone interview on 1/10/23 he reported he never
heard the term “posting up.” He also stated the youth are not allowed to
block other youth. If this were to happen, he would report it because
that should not be happening.
Documents Reviewed:
• Policy for Prohibited Interventions: Youth will not be allowed to
discipline other youth.
• Truancy Policy and Procedure: the policy does not mention
utilizing youth to block the doors.
4

Analysis The facility is in violation of the rule as four youth interviewed indicated
the staff utilize them to block the exits when other youth try to exit and
Youth B reported he restrained Youth A in order to stop him from
exiting.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the that
the current license status be continued.
